programmes.show_description: Swinging London, 1969. Zooming around London in his E-type Jaguar, Peter is an arrogant womaniser who picks up a variety of dolly birds. Contains sex scenes.
Kevin McNally stars as Porthos, one of the Three Musketeers, in this award-winning short drama.
Charming modern British comedy-romance. Three bored young women decide to go on holiday together to deepest Norfolk. With Sara Crowe, Nadia Sawalha and Leslie Philips.
Stories of people who have experienced infidelity, the reasons why people stray outside their relationship and if a relationship can ever survive.

Interviews with 19 men and women who were part of the Battle of Britain - unique accounts of the parts they played in the nation's defence, in their own words.
Comedy. A despondent man hires a professional assassin to take himself out. Stars David Jason and Monty Python's Graham Chapman.
Spy thriller. Promising Oxford University students are disappearing. An M15 investigation uncovers a pattern of accidents and arrests. Is the KGB involved? Terence Stamp stars.
Comedy. The story of Great Train Robber Buster Edwards, a small-timer who fell in with more ambitious thieves. Phil Collins and Julie Walters star.
Simon Templar is on holiday in Naples when he intervenes between an arguing Englishman and Italian. So begins his investigation into mafia crime. Roger Moore stars.
In this period caper, set in 1930s England, romance blooms between two very different people, an American thief and an Irish woman.
A shy astrology columnist is ordered to spice up his column by having affairs with a woman from each star sign then writing about it. Contains sex scenes and 80s social attitudes.
British thriller. Julie sells sexual favours to male clients at her health farm then blackmails them. Starring Georgina Ward, written by Hazel Adair. Contains sexual scenes and 70s social attitudes.
Solomon Watkins' quirky take as he interviews Michael, owner of the world's most unique collection of Really Thick Glasses. Funded and supported by Together TV and Cat Flap Media.

programmes.show_name: Can You Keep It Up For A Week?
programmes.show_description: Comedy. Annette will marry Gil, her hapless boyfriend, on condition he keeps his new job for a week without getting up to mischief with other women. Contains sexual scenes and 70s social attitudes.
The frank story of eight people's tempestuous relationship with alcohol - from first drink to rock bottom, we see what it took to get sober and build a new life in recovery.

16/35. Charlie and Lee head to Southampton to conjure Michelle's garden up into a tropical paradise - the perfect space to relax with friends and family - all for Â£6,000.
It's April and the fishing season has arrived. Alex and Peter go to sea in an Edwardian trawler. Ruth stays ashore and prepares potted shrimp.
DIY expert Dave Wellman prepares to repair and replaster a bedroom ceiling in a family home in Essex. 9/20

9/9. In a special episode, Alan Titchmarsh and his team transform a blank outside space at Keech hospice in Luton into a state of the art wildlife garden. Last in series.
Scottish-born actor Alan Cumming explores the picturesque Outer Hebrides of Scotland, touring the Western Isles from Barra to Stornoway on Lewis, Eriskay and the Callanish stones.
Dave Wellman is in Shirley coming to the rescue of two newlyweds as he demonstrates how to repair their rotten floorboards. 11/20
Dave is in Coventry, building a pair of his and hers wardrobes either side of a chimney breast in a master bedroom.12/20
1/8. A look behind the scenes at a dairy farm to see how they manage demand for milk. The sugar content of yoghurt. Sian looks into dairy alternatives.
1/8. How much will the collectors and dealers bid for a Banksy artwork, pickled pig foetuses and Tommy Cooper's fez?
Four children compete in two crafty upcycling challenges, working with recycled wood. Only two will make it through to the semi-finals of 'Crafty Champions'

Relive the glory days of good clean Hi-De-Hi style fun with this oral history of Britain's holiday camps. Hello Campers!

Tom Gaisford's film follows a gay trans man stepping into the ring for a boxing fight. This knockout documentary gives you a ringside seat to a situation gaining notoriety.
Portrait artist Alan Street is employed by the Soho Swingers Club to paint the hostesses. Whilst he relishes his new job his girlfriend is less than impressed. Contains nudity.
